text.p: NARODNA OBRODA - The Economics Ministry expects investment in the electronics industry to total around ten billion crowns by the year 2000. Some six billion crowns should come from its own sources, 2.3 billion crowns should be in the form of foreign investment and around 1.7 billion crowns should be financed from loans.
- Local money market dealers expect interbank interest rates to range between 25 and 35 percent this week.
- Financial damage from fires totalled more than 200 million crowns in the first half of this year.
SME - The opposition Democratic Party (DS) has demanded dismissal of the director of the official Slovak Television (STV) Igor Kubis. DS argues that STV is manipulated by the ruling coalition.

PRAVDA - Water levels on several Slovak rivers have increased due to rain over the weekend but the situation is under control on most of them. The worst situation is on the Danube and Morava, but both of them still have not reached critical levels.
- Prime Minister Vladimir Meciar said Slovakia would sign a treaty with the Vatican to specify relations between the church and state authorities in Slovakia.
PRACA - Several large Slovak companies said Slovakia's exclusion from the first wave of European Union enlargement would not have a strong direct impact on their business activities with the EU.
- The Slovak government on Saturday held a closed-door meeting outside Bratislava where it discussed creation of the 1998 state budget. No information about the discussion were made available.

HOSPODARSKE NOVINY - Slovakia will draw an ECU 25 million loan from the European Investment Bank to help finance building of a motorway connection between Bratislava and Austrian and Hungarian borders.
- The Czech companay Inekon said it would file a law suit against an unknown party that had stolen from its account 10 percent of the Slovak chemical company CHZN.
